intro: Nama jamaicensis var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender nama, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and wetlands.
